data.title: HTML5
data.desc: HTML5 is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web.

data.title: CSS3
data.desc: Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML.

data.title: Javascript
data.desc: Javascript is an object-oriented scripting language mainly used in HTML pages in which it adds dynamic content (modal...).

data.title: SCSS
data.desc: Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world.

data.title: PHP
data.desc: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language especially suited to web development.

data.title: MySQL
data.desc: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

data.title: Tailwind Css
data.desc: Tailwind CSS is a highly customizable, low-level CSS framework that gives you all of the building blocks you need to build bespoke designs without any annoying opinionated styles you have to fight to override.

data.title: Bootstrap
data.desc: Quickly design and customize responsive mobile-first sites with Bootstrap, the world’s most popular front-end open source toolkit, featuring Sass variables and mixins, responsive grid system, extensive prebuilt components, and powerful JavaScript plugins.

data.title: Unreal Engine
data.desc: The Unreal Engine is a game engine developed by Epic Games. Written in C++, its features a high degree of portability, supporting a wide range of platforms.

data.title: Python
data.desc: Python is a programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.

data.title: Vue.js
data.desc: Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Unlike other monolithic frameworks, Vue is designed from the ground up to be incrementally adoptable.

data.title: NuxtJs
data.desc: NuxtJs, built on top of Vue.js, is an open source framework making web development simple and powerful.

data.title: Laravel
data.desc: Laravel is a web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax. We’ve already laid the foundation — freeing you to create without sweating the small things.

data.title: GraphQL
data.desc: GraphQL is a query language for APIs and a runtime for fulfilling those queries with your existing data. GraphQL provides a complete and understandable description of the data in your API, gives clients the power to ask for exactly what they need and nothing more, makes it easier to evolve APIs over time, and enables powerful developer tools.

data.title: Git
data.desc: Git is a distributed version-control system for tracking changes in source code during software development. It is designed for coordinating work among programmers, but it can be used to track changes in any set of files.

data.title: Bitbucket
data.desc: Bitbucket is a web-based version control repository hosting service owned by Atlassian, for source code and development projects that use either Mercurial or Git revision control systems.

data.title: Trello
data.desc: Trello is a web-based Kanban-style list-making application which is a subsidiary of Atlassian.

data.title: Jekyll
data.desc: Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator for personal, project, or organization sites written in Ruby.

data.title: VS Code
data.desc: Visual Studio Code is a free source-code editor. Features include support for debugging, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, code refactoring, and embedded Git.

data.title: Sketchup
data.desc: SketchUp is a 3D modeling computer program for a wide range of drawing applications such as architectural, interior design, landscape architecture, civil and mechanical engineering, film and video game design.

data.title: Office
data.desc: Microsoft Office is a family of client software, server software, and services. Includes Outlook, OneDrive, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, SharePoint, Teams, and Yammer.

data.title: Photoshop
data.desc: Adobe Photoshop is a raster graphics editor.

data.title: Musescore
data.desc: MuseScore is a scorewriter supporting a wide variety of file formats and input methods.
